meanings.definition: Thin and tall in an unattractive way.
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow looked even lankier after the wind blew away some straw.
meanings.sent2: The model's lankier frame stood out on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The lankier tree in the forest seemed to be reaching for the sun.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the sturdy oak, the lankier birch tree appeared fragile.
meanings.sent5: Her lankier figure made her self-conscious in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Having a lean and elongated appearance.
meanings.sent1: The greyhound was lankier than the bulldog.
meanings.sent2: The runner's lankier build helped him glide through the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The lankier lamp post cast a long shadow in the evening light.
meanings.sent4: The lankier branches of the willow tree swayed gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: His lankier fingers easily reached the top shelf.
